title: Shamray snipes Wayway winner
text:
Report Error 
Riley Shamray of Shoal Lake scored on a power play in the second period and that marker held up as the winner as the host Waywayseecappo Wolverines edged the Virden Oil Capitals 2-1 on Friday night. 
In the other Manitoba Junior Hockey League games, it was: Neepawa Natives 2, OCN Blizzard 1; Selkirk Steelers 9, Dauphin Kings 7; Steinbach Pistons 7, Swan Valley Stampeders 2; and Winkler Flyers 3, Winnipeg Blues 2. 
At Waywayseecappo, Rylee Zimmer of Russell set up both goals for the Wolverines (2-4-1) with Aaron Dupasquier supplying the other marker, also on the man advantage. Brandonite Zach Whitecloud set up Dylan Thiessen’s power-play goal for the Oil Capitals (3-3-0), who had their three-game winning streak snapped. 
Natives 2 Blizzard 1 
At Carberry, about 450 people came out to watch the Natives improve to 3-5-0 on the season. Patrick Carlin and Reigan Buchanan scored for Neepawa, which got 29 saves from Troy Pierce. Kona Jackson was the only player from the Blizzard (2-2-2) to beat Pierce, while Emiliem Boily made 27 saves for OCN. 
Steelers 9 Kings 7 
At Selkirk, Brad Goethals recorded a hat trick and Ty Kraus chipped in with a goal and five assists for the Steelers (4-3-0), winners of three straight. Matthew Greening of Dauphin and Drake Bodie both had a goal and two assists, while Kirklan Lycar added a pair of markers and a helper for the Kings (3-4-0). 
Pistons 7 Stampeders 2 
At Steinbach, Tyler Penner’s two goals and three assists paced the Pistons (5-1-0), who have won five straight and fired 54 shots on goal. Brandonite James Shearer added a goal and two helpers. 
Jordie Valentino replied with both goals for the Stampeders (2-4-1). 
Flyers 3 Blues 2 
In Winkler, Zac Hicks of Boissevain had a goal and two helpers, while Virden’s Cam Whyte added a marker and an assist for the host Flyers (5-1-1). Josh Curtis and Kamerin Nault replied for Winnipeg (3-3-1). 
» The Brandon Sun
